mmj.pa

Class MacroManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmj.pa.MacroManager

  • public class MacroManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages access to the WorkVarManager resource and processes Work Var RunParms.

    Even though WorkVar and related classes are defined in the mmj.lang package, WorkVarBoss is coded as a separate "boss" so that Work Vars can be treated as a separate set of resources, separate from Logical System, Proof Assistant, etc. Initially though, WorkVars and friends are to be used with Proof Assistant -- and nowhere else.

      • runMacro

        public void runMacro(MacroManager.ExecutionMode mode,
                     java.lang.String[] args)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Run a macro given an argument list.
        Parameters:
        mode - The method in which this macro is getting called (for distinguishing which variables are set)
        args - The argument list; args[0] is the macro name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are any errors

      • setCallback

        public void setCallback(MacroManager.CallbackType c,
                        java.lang.Runnable r)
        Sets the callback for a given type of event. This function is intended to be called by macros. Only one callback is supported for each type, so macros should handle the organization of multiple event handlers.
        Parameters:
        c - The type of callback (event trigger)
        r - An interface to override with a (javascript) function

      • runCallback

        public void runCallback(MacroManager.CallbackType c)

        Parameters:
        c - The type of callback (event trigger)
